content: - install importexporttools addon if not already done - click Local Folders' and rightclick and create new folder for each folder to recover - highlight one of the new folders, rightclick and select importexport menu option to import mbox and the select of of the folders (IGNORE the msf entries) - repeat for each folder - now, you have recovered the messages. if you want to merge them into another Local folder or into a POP folder, you can repeat the process, somewhat, by highlighting each of the new folders, rightclick and select importexport option to export as eml - then, click the receiving folder, rightclick and select to import eml and that will merge the messages.
creator: davidsk

content: How would a fellow user even begin to guess? You might start by asking your account provider.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: here is how i do it: - exit thunderbird on old PC - copy c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird to external media (this assumes you use default installation) - on new PC, install thunderbird and exit - copy the backed-up thunderbird folder to c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming to overwrite the existing thunderbird folder - start thunderbird
creator: davidsk

content:
As you were told in your previous two threads like https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1453607

Thunderbird is a email client installed on your Windows system as It is Not a server or email service.

Perhaps your email provider(s) is having issues so you need to find out from them. Your provider would be the one after the @ like for example @gmail.com @comcast.net @yahoo.com etc.

Also this is a public community forum and nobody here will be calling or texting you at some random posted phone#.

So you know, to reply in a forum thread that is not locked, scroll down to the Post a Reply box, then type in your reply, then click on the Post Reply.

Locking this one as we do not need yet another thread asking the same question.
creator: James

content:
Per quanto ne so l'accesso ai servizi email di TIM (Tim, Tin, Alice) tramite client è possibile solo se si è clienti TIM. Vedi: -> https://www.tim.it/assistenza/assistenza-tecnica/mail/configurazione/client-pc

Puoi accedere alla tua TIM Mail sia da webmail che da Client di posta (Gmail, Outlook,...) se: - hai una mail @tim.it @alice.it @tin.it associata a una linea attiva TIM fissa o mobile - hai una mail @tim.it @alice.it @tin.it non associata a una linea attiva TIM fissa o mobile ma sei connesso alla rete TIM fissa o mobile. L’accesso alla mail con Operatore diverso da TIM è consentito solo tramite webmail.

content: Try this: - click account settings for the account and then click synchronization&settings and click the advanced tab to verify that the folder is accessible offline. - then, on the menu bar, click file>offline>download
